meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Spraying for Virus in Queens New York City is prepared to begin ground spraying for mosquitoes next week in Corona if tests confirm that a chicken being used as part of an early warning system was infected with the West Nile virus. PAGE B1

Spraying for Virus in Queens New York City is prepared to begin ground spraying for mosquitoes next week in Corona if tests confirm that a chicken being used as part of an early warning system was infected with the West Nile virus. PAGE B1

Clinton and Arafat Meet The President and Yasir Arafat held talks in Washington but were unable to settle the last obstacles to holding a summit meeting, an administration official said. Still, the White House is not giving up. PAGE A6

Yanks' Knoblauch Walks Off Second baseman Chuck Knoblauch, who has been frustrated by throwing problems, made three more errors last night, then took himself out of the game and was sent home so he could avoid reporters. PAGE D1

Golf Architect Dies The prolific golf architect Robert Trent Jones Sr., who designed or remodeled more than 500 courses, including 79 used in the U.S. Open or other national championships, died in Florida at the age of 93. PAGE C21
